intro: Nasturtium globosum var. brachypetalum, commonly known as the dwarf nasturtium, is a compact, annual plant native to South America. It features heart-shaped, waxy leaves and produces small, vibrant orange or yellow flowers. The plant is characterized by its short stature, typically growing to only 10–20 cm in height. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for container gardening. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a useful plant for attracting pollinators.
